query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Già era in loco onde s’udia ’l rimbombo 2 de l’acqua che cadea ne l’altro giro, 3 simile a quel che l’arnie fanno rombo,
4 quando tre ombre insieme si partiro, 5 correndo, d’una torma che passava 6 sotto la pioggia de l’aspro martiro.
query.result:
1 Already he was in the place where the rumble 2 of the water that fell in the other circle was heard, 3 similar to the buzzing that the beehives make,
4 when three shades together departed, 5 running, from a group that was passing 6 under the rain of the harsh martyrdom.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
7 Venian ver’ noi, e ciascuna gridava: 8 «Sòstati tu ch’a l’abito ne sembri 9 esser alcun di nostra terra prava».
query.result: 7 They were coming towards us, and each one was shouting: 8 "Stop, you who by your attire seem to us 9 to be someone from our wicked land".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Ahimè, che piaghe vidi ne’ lor membri, 11 ricenti e vecchie, da le fiamme incese! 12 Ancor men duol pur ch’i’ me ne rimembri.
query.result: 10 Alas, what wounds I saw on their limbs, 11 recent and old, burnt by the flames! 12 I still grieve just to remember them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 A le lor grida il mio dottor s’attese; 14 volse ’l viso ver’ me, e «Or aspetta», 15 disse, «a costor si vuole esser cortese.

Please translate literally into English.
16 E se non fosse il foco che saetta 17 la natura del loco, i’ dicerei 18 che meglio stesse a te che a lor la fretta».
query.result: 16 And if it were not for the fire that shoots out 17 from the nature of the place, I would say 18 that haste would suit you better than them".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 Ricominciar, come noi restammo, ei 20 l’antico verso; e quando a noi fuor giunti, 21 fenno una rota di sé tutti e trei.
query.result: 19 They started again, as we stopped, their 20 old chant; and when they reached us, 21 they made a circle of themselves, all three.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
22 Qual sogliono i campion far nudi e unti, 23 avvisando lor presa e lor vantaggio, 24 prima che sien tra lor battuti e punti,
25 così rotando, ciascuno il visaggio 26 drizzava a me, sì che ’n contraro il collo 27 faceva ai piè continüo vïaggio.
query.result:
22 As naked and oiled wrestlers are accustomed to do, 23 considering their hold and their advantage, 24 before they are struck and wounded by each other,
25 thus, rotating, each one turned his face 26 towards me, so that his neck made 27 a continuous journey in the opposite direction to his feet.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 E «Se miseria d’esto loco sollo 29 rende in dispetto noi e nostri prieghi», 30 cominciò l’uno, «e ’l tinto aspetto e brollo,
31 la fama nostra il tuo animo pieghi 32 a dirne chi tu se’, che i vivi piedi 33 così sicuro per lo ’nferno freghi.
query.result:
28 And "If the misery of this gloomy place 29 makes us and our prayers contemptible", 30 began one of them, "and our scorched and naked appearance,
31 may our fame incline your mind 32 to tell us who you are, that you tread 33 so confidently through Hell with living feet.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
34 Questi, l’orme di cui pestar mi vedi, 35 tutto che nudo e dipelato vada, 36 fu di grado maggior che tu non credi:
37 nepote fu de la buona Gualdrada; 38 Guido Guerra ebbe nome, e in sua vita 39 fece col senno assai e con la spada.
query.result:
34 This one, whose footprints you see me treading on, 35 although he goes naked and hairless, 36 was of a higher rank than you think:
37 he was the grandson of the good Gualdrada; 38 his name was Guido Guerra, and in his lifetime 39 he accomplished much with his wisdom and his sword.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
40 L’altro, ch’appresso me la rena trita, 41 è Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, la cui voce 42 nel mondo sù dovria esser gradita.
query.result: 40 The other one, who treads the sand beside me, 41 is Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, whose voice 42 should be held in esteem in the world above.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 E io, che posto son con loro in croce, 44 Iacopo Rusticucci fui, e certo 45 la fiera moglie più ch’altro mi nuoce».
query.result: 43 And I, who am placed on the cross with them, 44 was Iacopo Rusticucci, and certainly 45 my shrewish wife harms me more than anything else".

46 If I had been covered by the fire, 47 I would have thrown myself down among them, 48 and I believe that my guide would have allowed it;
49 but because I would have been burnt and cooked, 50 fear overcame my good will 51 that made me eager to embrace them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 Poi cominciai: «Non dispetto, ma doglia 53 la vostra condizion dentro mi fisse, 54 tanta che tardi tutta si dispoglia,
55 tosto che questo mio segnor mi disse 56 parole per le quali i’ mi pensai 57 che qual voi siete, tal gente venisse.
query.result:
52 Then I began: "Not contempt, but sorrow 53 for your condition pierced me within, 54 so much so that it will take a long time to be completely dispelled,
55 as soon as my lord here spoke to me 56 words that made me think 57 that people like you were coming.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
58 Di vostra terra sono, e sempre mai 59 l’ovra di voi e li onorati nomi 60 con affezion ritrassi e ascoltai.
query.result: 58 I am from your land, and I have always 59 recounted and listened to your deeds and your honored names 60 with affection.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
61 Lascio lo fele e vo per dolci pomi 62 promessi a me per lo verace duca; 63 ma ’nfino al centro pria convien ch’i’ tomi».

Please translate literally into English.
64 «Se lungamente l’anima conduca 65 le membra tue», rispuose quelli ancora, 66 «e se la fama tua dopo te luca,
67 cortesia e valor dì se dimora 68 ne la nostra città sì come suole, 69 o se del tutto se n’è gita fora;
70 ché Guiglielmo Borsiere, il qual si duole 71 con noi per poco e va là coi compagni, 72 assai ne cruccia con le sue parole».

Please translate literally into English.
73 «La gente nuova e i sùbiti guadagni 74 orgoglio e dismisura han generata, 75 Fiorenza, in te, sì che tu già ten piagni».
query.result: 73 "The new people and the sudden gains 74 have generated pride and excess, 75 Florence, in you, so that you already lament it".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
76 Così gridai con la faccia levata; 77 e i tre, che ciò inteser per risposta, 78 guardar l’un l’altro com’ al ver si guata.

Please translate literally into English.
79 «Se l’altre volte sì poco ti costa», 80 rispuoser tutti, «il satisfare altrui, 81 felice te se sì parli a tua posta!
82 Però, se campi d’esti luoghi bui 83 e torni a riveder le belle stelle, 84 quando ti gioverà dicere “I’ fui”,
85 fa che di noi a la gente favelle».
query.result:
79 "If it costs you so little to satisfy others", 80 they all replied, "the other times, 81 happy are you if you speak so at your leisure!
82 Therefore, if you escape from these dark places 83 and return to see the beautiful stars again, 84 when it will please you to say "I was",
85 make sure to tell people about us".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
86 Indi rupper la rota, e a fuggirsi 87 ali sembiar le gambe loro isnelle.
88 Un amen non saria possuto dirsi 89 tosto così com’ e’ fuoro spariti; 90 per ch’al maestro parve di partirsi.
query.result:
86 Then they broke the circle, and their swift legs 87 seemed like wings to carry them away.
88 An amen could not have been said 89 as quickly as they disappeared; 90 so it seemed to my master that it was time to leave.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
91 Io lo seguiva, e poco eravam iti, 92 che ’l suon de l’acqua n’era sì vicino, 93 che per parlar saremmo a pena uditi.
query.result: 91 I followed him, and we had gone a short distance, 92 when the sound of the water was so near, 93 that we would have been scarcely heard if we had spoken.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
94 Come quel fiume c’ha proprio cammino 95 prima dal Monte Viso ’nver’ levante, 96 da la sinistra costa d’Apennino,
97 che si chiama Acquacheta suso, avante 98 che si divalli giù nel basso letto, 99 e a Forlì di quel nome è vacante,
100 rimbomba là sovra San Benedetto 101 de l’Alpe per cadere ad una scesa 102 ove dovea per mille esser recetto;
103 così, giù d’una ripa discoscesa, 104 trovammo risonar quell’ acqua tinta, 105 sì che ’n poc’ ora avria l’orecchia offesa.
query.result:
94 Like that river which has its own course 95 first from Monte Viso towards the east, 96 from the left side of the Apennines,
97 which is called Acquacheta above, before 98 it descends down into the low channel, 99 and in Forlì that name is vacant,
100 it roars there above San Benedetto 101 dell'Alpe to fall down a slope 102 where it was to be received by a thousand;
103 thus, down a steep bank, 104 we found that dark water resounding, 105 so that in a short time it would have offended the ear.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
106 Io avea una corda intorno cinta, 107 e con essa pensai alcuna volta 108 prender la lonza a la pelle dipinta.
query.result: 106 I had a cord wrapped around me, 107 and with it I once thought 108 to catch the leopard with the spotted skin.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
109 Poscia ch’io l’ebbi tutta da me sciolta, 110 sì come ’l duca m’avea comandato, 111 porsila a lui aggroppata e ravvolta.
query.result: 109 After I had completely untied it from myself, 110 just as my guide had commanded me, 111 I handed it to him, knotted and coiled.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
112 Ond’ ei si volse inver’ lo destro lato, 113 e alquanto di lunge da la sponda 114 la gittò giuso in quell’ alto burrato.
query.result: 112 Then he turned towards the right side, 113 and from a little distance from the bank 114 he threw it down into that deep precipice.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
115 ‘E’ pur convien che novità risponda’, 116 dicea fra me medesmo, ‘al novo cenno 117 che ’l maestro con l’occhio sì seconda’.
query.result: 115 'And it is fitting that something new should respond', 116 I said to myself, 'to the new signal 117 that my master follows so intently with his eyes'.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
118 Ahi quanto cauti li uomini esser dienno 119 presso a color che non veggion pur l’ovra, 120 ma per entro i pensier miran col senno!
121 El disse a me: «Tosto verrà di sovra 122 ciò ch’io attendo e che il tuo pensier sogna; 123 tosto convien ch’al tuo viso si scovra».
query.result:
118 Ah, how cautious men should be 119 in the presence of those who not only see the deed, 120 but also penetrate the thoughts with their minds!
121 He said to me: "Soon there will come from above 122 what I am waiting for and what your thoughts dream of; 123 soon it must reveal itself to your sight".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
124 Sempre a quel ver c’ha faccia di menzogna 125 de’ l’uom chiuder le labbra fin ch’el puote, 126 però che sanza colpa fa vergogna;
127 ma qui tacer nol posso; e per le note 128 di questa comedìa, lettor, ti giuro, 129 s’elle non sien di lunga grazia vòte,
130 ch’i’ vidi per quell’ aere grosso e scuro 131 venir notando una figura in suso, 132 maravigliosa ad ogne cor sicuro,
133 sì come torna colui che va giuso 134 talora a solver l’àncora ch’aggrappa 135 o scoglio o altro che nel mare è chiuso,
136 che ’n sù si stende e da piè si rattrappa.
query.result:
124 A man should always keep his lips sealed 125 from the truth that has the appearance of a lie, as long as he can, 126 because it brings shame without fault;
127 but here I cannot be silent; and by the notes 128 of this comedy, reader, I swear to you, 129 if they are not devoid of lasting grace,
130 that I saw a figure swimming upwards 131 through that thick and murky air, 132 a marvel to any steadfast heart,
133 just as he who sometimes goes down 134 to free the anchor that grapples 135 a rock or something else that is hidden in the sea,
136 stretches out his arms and draws his feet together.
